p: The chemical composition and biological activity of essential oils can be affected by many factors, including which part of the plant is used for essential oil isolation [ 39]. Indeed, we observed differences in the essential oil composition in flowers and leaves from Ferula iliensis [ 40] and Hypericum perforatum [ 41]. Thus, we extracted essential oils from M. fistulosa flowers (MEO Fl) and leaves (MEO Lv). The MEO Fl and MEO Lv extraction yields (v/w) were 1.3% and 4.4%, respectively, which are much higher than those reported previously by Mattarelli et al. (0.33â€“0.50%) [ 10]. The chemical composition of these essential oils was evaluated using gas chromatography-flame ionization detector (GC-FID) and gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS) simultaneously, and Table 2 and Table 3 summarize the compounds identified, percentage composition, and relative retention indices (RRI) (compounds are listed in order of their elution).
